class_notes: EMPH Students Only; Outside permission to enroll in course must be approved by EMPH leadership. EMPH Opening Weekend is January 12-14 and Closing Weekend is April 12-14.
course_description: Pre-Requisites: PRS 500D as prerequisite or special permission required to enroll. Epidemiology 504D is an introductory epidemiology course covering the underlying concepts and methods of epidemiology and the applications of epidemiology to public health. Topics covered in the course include: study design (clinical trials, cohort studies, case-control studies, and cross-sectional studies), measures of disease occurrence and association, bias, confounding, interaction, and analysis of two-by-two tables. [Applied Epidemiology students take AEPI 530D instead of EPI 504D.]
prerequisites:
Prereq. for AEPI Students: AEPI 530D, AEPI 534D, AEPI 536D, AEPI 538D, BIOS 516D, BIOS 517D, BIOS 518D, or by special permission to enroll.
Prereq. for PRS Students: PRS 505D, PRS 535D, PRS 542D, as prerequisites or by special permission to enroll.
